name: GetCustomFieldSettingsForProject
description:
Get custom field settings for a specified project.

Use this tool to retrieve all custom field settings associated with a specific project in Asana. It returns a list in compact form, which can be expanded using `opt_fields` to include additional data.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the Asana project to retrieve custom field settings.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of custom field settings to return per page, between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: An offset token for pagination. Use the token from a previous request to get the next page of results. If not provided, it returns the first page.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of property names to include in the response, expanding beyond the default fields.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable to receive a pretty, human-readable response with line breaks and indentation. Increases response time and size, use for debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:

*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*
